duties_responsibilities.duty: Facilitate project communication – develop communication plans and execute them to keep all involved parties aligned (development teams, business teams, vendors, etc.)
Identify and manage project risks
Help define and maintain project roadmap, manage release plan and development priorities accordingly
Facilitate collection of new business requirements and effort estimation for upcoming initiatives
Maintain project tools and documentation traceability (tasks, delivery plan, scope changes, etc.)
Work with business analysts, technical leaders, developers, architects, test leads towards providing efficient solutions which meet needs of the business
Ensure SDLC methodology is followed for the project in accordance with company standards and guidelines
Manage project - plan, assign resources, coordinate project schedule and dependencies, track project status and drive it forward
Tailor the process to meet projects needs and ensuring continuous process improvement
Oversee sprint planning and retrospectives, and conduct daily stands up
Manage a distributed team of developers and testers – at least 3 years
Deep understanding of SDLC
Practical understanding in PM methodologies including waterfall and iterative approaches and ability to work in hybrid project model
Good negotiation skills
Ability to independently manage, organize and prioritize multiple tasks and responsibilities
Transparent, structure and result-oriented approach
Analytical mindset
Manage Production issues and ensure the issue is tracked
Ability to handle multiple project streams within the team
Provides project and release status to stakeholders
Manage release timelines for Development, QA, UAT, and Production
Identify issues and risks and proactively add to the iterative discussion
Communicate efficiently within and outside the team
Strong organizational, time management skills

education_certification.credential: Scrum-certified with at least 3 years of hands-on experience in the Scrum Master role, Project Manager experience with waterfall and iterative projects – at least 3 years
